metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10196 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
NULL pointer dereference vulnerability in the rebuild_vlists function in lib/dotgen/conc.c in the dotgen library in Graphviz 2.40.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10196` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphviz - 2.40.1-7build1
libcdt5 - 2.40.1-7build1
libcgraph6 - 2.40.1-7build1
libgv-guile - 2.40.1-7build1
libgv-lua - 2.40.1-7build1
libgv-perl - 2.40.1-7build1
libgv-ruby - 2.40.1-7build1
libgv-tcl - 2.40.1-7build1
libgvc6 - 2.40.1-7build1
libgvc6-plugins-gtk - 2.40.1-7build1
libgvpr2 - 2.40.1-7build1
liblab-gamut1 - 2.40.1-7build1
libpathplan4 - 2.40.1-7build1
libxdot4 - 2.40.1-7build1
python3-gv - 2.40.1-7build1
No subscription required

notes.Note: eslerm> trusty needs at least upstream commit 2296633 to backport

criterions.comment: graphviz package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.40.1-7build1').
